Case reference: 2016069646.CaseDesc: James Kunuk was reported missing by his landlord in December, 2016.  He was last seen by his family on September 21st, 2016 in Whitehorse, Yukon.  Mr. Kunuk has previously lived in downtown Vancouver, and also has family connections to the Northwest Territories.  He did not contact his family for his birthday, or over the Christmas holidays, which is unusual for him.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Cross with "Life" written on it

Case reference: 2018063272.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2002, Wayne McMahon was seen for the last time by his building's superintendent in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006627.CaseDesc: On November 9, 2012, Andria Meise was reported missing from Kelowna, British Columbia. Andria was last seen in Grande Prairie, Alberta between July 2010 and September 2010. Andria was known to be living a high risk lifestyle and traveled between Grande Prairie, Dawson Creek, Fort St. John, Kelowna and Vancouver.

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2014005323.CaseDesc: Darrell Hoshowski was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta, in July 1983. Prior to his disappearance, Darrell had made a withdrawal from his bank account. There is reason to believe that he may have travelled, and Vancouver, British Columbia and California were mentioned as being possible destinations.

Case reference: 2013000074.CaseDesc: Pasquale Giannetti has been missing from Montreal since November 26, 1984. His vehicle was located at L'Ile Ste-Hélène and his clothes were found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge.

Case reference: 2006019599.CaseDesc: Frank Szpak left his residence on September 23, 1996. He indicated he was going to pick blueberries and never returned. Mr. Szpak suffered from Alzheimer's Disease.

Hat: Blue, Baseball cap with "Motorola" on the front

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2016068945.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1965, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were discovered in the forest behind a farm on Lot 4, Conc. 5, Townsend Township, Waterford, Ontario. He is described as well-developed and muscular. Time since death is estimated to be approximately 2 years.

Teeth: No evidence of dental work (fillings), but he was missing four teeth.
Tie: With a silver coloured tie clip
Boots: Heavy leather boots with buckles on the outside near the top and over the instep. 11" high
Jacket: Dark coloured, zippered, two layer windbreaker with a satiny lining
Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Waterproof, shockproof
Glasses: Glasses with non-prescription lenses and a glasses case  with "John N. King, Toronto" on it.

Case reference: 2014001521.CaseDesc: On November 3, 1972, a helicopter carrying a pilot and three passengers went missing in Lake Winnipeg. The helicopter left Thompson, Manitoba at 3:20 p.m. and was heading for Winnipeg after stopping at a number of communities. The helicopter landed at Warren's Landing at approximately 5:20 p.m., and left for Winnipeg. The pilot reported that the weather was poor and he estimated his arrival in Winnipeg at 8:00 p.m. At 5:50 p.m. there was radio contact with the pilot where he stated that he was over Poplar River. This was the last radio contact with this helicopter. The Canadian Air Search and Rescue, private aircraft and police aircraft searched until November 17, 1972 when the search was suspended until the spring of 1973. Nathan Kryger and Ian Fraser are presumed dead as a result of the helicopter crash. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2012020662.CaseDesc: Marc April was last seen at approximately 6:30 p.m. on the January 31, 1987, at the Saskatoon City Hospital. Mr. April was a patient at a hospital at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2006008599.CaseDesc: Adrien McNaughton wandered off into a wooded area of Holmes Lake, Brougham Township, on June 12, 1972.

Scar: Forehead, approximately 1 - 2 inches long, and possibly over the left eye.

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2013000126.CaseDesc: In December 2007, Bonnie Marie Joseph was reported missing to the Fort St-James RCMP.  Further investigation determined that Miss Joseph was last seen on September 8, 2007 in Vanderhoof, BC.  She led a high risk lifestyle and was known to hitchhike alone between Fort St-James, Vanderhoof and Prince George, BC.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, heart with Mom & Djily

Case reference: 2020022042.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1996, the body of a man believed to be between the ages of 30-40 was found in a hotel room in downtown Quebec City, Quebec. The man expressed himself in English and he had with him a travel bag containing several personal belongings, suggesting that he came from outside the region or country.

Hair: Brown, Curly, Short, Shaved on sides, curly on top
Watch: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Gold, Brand GUESS

Case reference: 2014006024.CaseDesc: On March 10, 2013, Richard Bailey was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was reported missing by his wife the next day when he failed to return home from work.

Case reference: 2013000038.CaseDesc: Samuel Lachance was last seen at the Beverage Room in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan near the end of July, 1987. Samuel was in very good physical condition at the time of his disappearance and worked in different logging camps in Saskatchewan. Family members say that it was unusual for Samuel not to have any contact with them or his friends near the time he was last seen.

Case reference: 2016046700.CaseDesc: Mr. LADD was last seen on August 18, 2016, by his daughter at his residence where he prepared them dinner.  Mr. LADD stated he needed to run out for a while and did not return.

Case reference: 2009003899.CaseDesc: Investigation revealed that Emile Ruger, who resides on Brookdale Ave., had not paid his rent for the month of March and April 2008.  Mr. Ruger usually pays his rent three days in advance to the month due. He was last seen mid-February 2008 and his whereabouts are unknown. Last Seen: Rooming House on Brookdale Avenue

Case reference: 2018010790.CaseDesc: In December of 2017, Willard Duval was seen last in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Willard had not been seen or heard from in two months.

Case reference: 2012020141.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1999, at approximately 9:00 p.m., Julie Surprenant was seen for the last time as she got off of a bus in the neighbourhood of L’Île St-Jean, in Montreal, Quebec. None of the clothing that she had worn that day were found at her residence; which suggests that Julie did not go home after getting off of the bus.

Case reference: 2014006193.CaseDesc: At approximately 7:30 a.m. on July 11, 2013, Randy George was dropped off on Hwy #21 near the north side of the Big Island Lake Cree Territory, SK. He was last seen walking north on the highway. There have been no confirmed sightings of Mr. George since that time.

Case reference: 2014005604.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2011, Dorothy Thomas was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Prior to being reported missing, Dorothy had not returned home for eighteen days.

Case reference: 2010006399.CaseDesc: Glen Wesley, a patient at the Northeast Mental Health Hospital, was granted permission to leave the facility on his birthday. Staff believe he went to downtown North Bay. Mr. Wesley did not return and was noticed missing at approximately 2:15 PM. He suffers from Schizophrenia which requires medication. Since his disappearance there have been several unconfirmed sightings of Mr. Wesley in the Cochrane, Timmins and New Liskeard areas.

Case reference: 2014002176.CaseDesc: On October 1st, 1997 in Fort McMurray, RCMP received a report that Michelle Renee McGillion had not been seen since the evening of September 30th, 1997. Ms. McGillion's roommate reported that she had found a suicide note in the residence.  Ms. McGillion is described as having a substance abuse problem which included alcohol and prescribed anti-depression medication.  Ms. McGillion had ties to Fort McMurray, Alberta, Yukon, and Ontario, where her family resides.

Case reference: 2021015231.CaseDesc: On December 8, 2017, at approximately 1:06 p.m., James Ryding was seen for the last time as he left his apartment in Niagara Falls, New York. During the time of his disappearance, James may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2014003366.CaseDesc: The morning of July 8, 1981,  the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP were notified that an aluminum boat with an outboard motor was going in circles just out from the new houses in Sheshatshiu, NL.  Police were advised that the boat was unoccupied and travelling quite fast in circles. The investigation determined that the boat had been once occupied by John Morris Groves of North West River, NL and it appears that he had fallen overboard.  The body of Mr. Groves has not yet been located.

Case reference: 2015020897.CaseDesc: In April of 2015, Delmer Paul Bonnetrouge was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2006010799.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1979, Keith Cromwell was last seen as he departed from Quarry Island/Lake of the Woods, near Kenora, Ontario, in a motor boat. Keith never arrived at his destination, Fog Island.

Case reference: 2013000092.CaseDesc: Jacques Boulanger was last seen on September 1, 1989 from Montreal. Jacques loved sleeping outside even though he had a home.

Case reference: 2007005299.CaseDesc: Shelley Mathieu-Read resided in Sarnia, Ontario. She was last seen on May 20, 2007 in Sarnia but has not been heard from since. An extensive investigation by the Sarnia Police Service has failed to locate her.

Scar: Forehead, from hairline running down into forhead
Tattoo: Right Foot, graphic of a star

Case reference: 2014003927.CaseDesc: On April 8, 1983, Blake Moorehouse was last seen between 2:00 pm and 6:00 pm in Richmond, British Columbia. There is reason to believe that Mr. Moorehouse and his companion Harold Brentzen left for the day to go freshwater fishing. The boat that Mr. Moorehouse and Mr.Brentzen were on board was recovered approximately 1.2 km north of the Roberts Creek Terminal. Mr. Brentzen's body was recovered near the boat, but Mr. Moorehouse was not located.

Case reference: 2014001268.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1998, Terry Jasman wandered off from the Bow City Gravel Pit on the Bow River near Brooks, Alberta.  Terry Jasman's trailer and truck were later found abandoned.

Jeans: Denim, Light Blue, Faded blue jeans

Case reference: 2016008144.CaseDesc: Ben Trommels was last seen at his residence after being dropped off at 6:00 p.m. on Thursday, February 11, 2016.  It is believed that he left his apartment on foot that evening.  Ben suffers from mental health issues.

Hair: Brown, often has a shaved head
Coat: Black, winter; with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2014001666.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1995, Shawn McEleney was last seen in Edmonton, Alberta. Shawn was known to attend the racing tracks in Edmonton and Calgary.

Case reference: 2006010699.CaseDesc: Greg Gan departed from the family home, on foot, on October 19, 1978. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Ski coat; Brand-North Face

Case reference: 2014006137.CaseDesc: On January 2, 2012, Spencer Joly was last seen in Vernon BC. Spencer told a number of people he was travelling to the Kelowna Airport and eventually flying to Phuket Thailand. Spencer was seen later that same day being dropped off by Taxi in Predator Ridge, a new housing development in Vernon. There was no record of Spencer ever leaving the country or arriving in Thailand.

Case reference: 2012020147.CaseDesc: On March 25, 1996, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Upper Levels Highway in West Vancouver, British Columbia. The man had recovered from severe injuries to his right arm and leg. He also had a fractured skull, nose and ribs. These injuries were likely a result of a single major accident. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains.

Jacket: Corduroy, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 3/4 length coat with fleece
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Side Of Head, Recent fracture to the left temporal bone above the left ear
Nose, Old nasal fracture with visible deformity
Deformity: Shoulders, Old injury; no indication of which shoulder

Case reference: 2014004940.CaseDesc: On May 24, 2006, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Shemron King was seen for the last time by his father in Toronto, Ontario. When his father returned home, Shemrom and his mother were gone.

Case reference: 2008005099.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1976, Robert McDonald’s employer advised that he had not shown up for work and had not been seen since January 16, 1976. On January 28, 1976 it was reported that Mr. McDonald was seen hitchhiking south out of Ear Falls on Highway 105. Mr. McDonald has not been seen since. He was 33 years old at the time of his disappearance and was last seen at Griffith Mines, north of Ear Falls, ON.

Jacket: Blue, White, skidoo with white stripes

Case reference: 2012002099.CaseDesc: Kelly Coleman was last seen near Mac's Convenience on Mapleview Drive in Barrie, Ontario in August 2011.  Kelly suffers from health-related issues and has not had contact with her family or friends since January 3, 2012. They are concerned for her well-being and are requesting assistance from anyone who may have had any contact with her.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2016040859.CaseDesc: On July 19, 2016, Deana Mildred Wertz was last seen at her residence on Yankee Flats Road near Salmon Arm BC. Later that same morning she spoke with family members by phone indicating she was going for a hike without her dog which was unusual. The area where Deanna is believed to have gone is the area surrounding Yankee Flats Rd near Salmon Arm BC which is steep mountainous terrain with a number of trail systems. She left without any personal possessions, cash or identification.

Case reference: 2013000013.CaseDesc: On April 27, 1967, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Marianne Schuett was seen for the last time in the vicinity of the Kilbride Public School's driveway in North Burlington, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Marianne was seen talking to an unknown man in a vehicle, and it is believed that she was abducted by this man.

Hair: Brown, Bangs in front, ear length at back

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014004732.CaseDesc: Waylon Edwin Smith was last seen in the Lake St. Martin area of Manitoba.  He had lived in Winnipeg and gone to Lake St. Martin to visit family.  He went for a walk and never returned.  He suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2021001787.CaseDesc: On January 10, 2021, Sébastien Lavallée was seen for the last time when he left his residence. Sébastien had mentioned that he was going to go for a walk on the lake in the ‘MRC des Deux-Montagnes’ in Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Sébastien was engaged in a high-risk lifestyle, and was suffering from mental health problems.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Implant retained dentures, upper and lower

Case reference: 2014001016.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1983, the body of an unidentified man was found floating on the St-Lawrence river between L’ile Bouchard et St-Sulpice in Quebec. The man wore a partial upper denture and was missing three teeth.

Case reference: 2014004546.CaseDesc: On November 10, 2004, Roy Lewis was last seen hitchhiking in Sackville, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2014001301.CaseDesc: On September 11, 1999, Harold Donald Maskell was reported missing by his cousin Mike Viger. Harold’s cousin had come to visit him at his residence in Coles Island, New Brunswick, but there was no sign of him at the house. A search of the shoreline of the Canaan River returned negative results. Harold does not drive and cannot walk very far.

Shirt: Red, Plaid, Plaid; red, white, blue

Case reference: 2014003404.CaseDesc: Armand Comtois was reported missing on May 2, 1985. At the time of his disappearance he was living in Saint-Hyacinthe, Quebec. He was seen by a family member on March 9, 1985 but he has not been seen or heard from since this date. He also used the name of "Simon".

Teeth: Dental appliance, partial composed of 4 upper teeth.

Case reference: 2006015199.CaseDesc: Robert Asher was last seen in Dunnville, Ontario during the winter of 1982. He has not been seen since. Mr. Asher may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance. His vehicle has not been recovered. Mr. Asher was involved with illicit drugs and alcohol at the time of his disappearance.

Jewelry: Gold, Necklace with a diamond ring attached

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2006025299.CaseDesc: Eetu Vainonen has been missing from the Thunder Bay (Port Arthur) area since sometime during 1935 to 1936.

Case reference: 2014002717.CaseDesc: Mr. Giuseppe Colina was last seen on March 15, 1979, in Montreal. On that day he left his home early to go work. He told his co-workers he was leaving earlier because he had things to do and did not complete his work day.

Case reference: 2005006799.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1978, an unidentified woman was discovered in an area of bush on the Chudleigh’s Farm in Milton, Ontario.

Teeth: Other, Had been edentulous for many years prior to her death.

Case reference: 2006019199.CaseDesc: Marion Thiessen was reported missing by her husband in November, 1979. She has gone missing several times in the past and it has been discovered that she lived in Vancouver, British Columbia about 28 years ago.  She contacted an acquaintance in 1984, but there has been no contact with Marion Thiessen since that time.

Teeth: False, Partial dentures on both lower and upper teeth.

Case reference: 2006017199.CaseDesc: Mistie Murray was last seen on May 31, 1995, in the Goderich area.

Teeth: Space between her two upper front teeth

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 2013000098.CaseDesc: On September 5, 1974, eight men were on a drilling barge. As they were making no headway against a strong current, it was agreed upon to park the barge for the night. The eight men worked together to park the vessel however one of the legs failed to lower, causing the barge to tip. Donald Bradburn was amongst the men who were thrown from the barge. Despite dragging operations Mr. Bradburn has never been located.

Case reference: 2014005052.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2007, Ohanes Melkon was last seen when he departed his residence located in Innisfail, Alberta to go purchase food.

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2014001281.CaseDesc: On April 7, 1982, a volunteer with Meals on Wheels reported to the police that, despite numerous attempts, they had not been able to contact Thelma Haskins. Police checked her home, however she was not there and they found nothing suspicious.  None of Mrs. Haskins' friends had seen her, and she had not frequented any local businesses.  Ground searches of the area and of the walking trails Mrs. Haskins frequented did not reveal any trace of her.  Mrs. Haskins has not been located.

Hair: Black, Short, hair is turning grey

Case reference: 2014003011.CaseDesc: In June 1980, William Dailey, an American citizen, left his home in New York State and traveled to Alaska with two friends. William was last seen in July 1980, in the Yukon on the return trip from Alaska. The men had been travelling in a 1972 Dodge dark blue flatbed pick-up truck with racks.

Case reference: 2012020183.CaseDesc: The skeletal remains of an adolescent were located in Terrace.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Some dental work and some teeth missing

Case reference: 2014005882.CaseDesc: Romeo Cloutier was last seen September 13, 2012 in Moncton (NB). His vehicle was located in Sainte-Marie-de-Kent later on that same day. No other confirmed reports of his whereabouts have been made since.

Tattoo: Neck, Inscription "Keep your friends close, keep enemies closer"

Case reference: 2014003711.CaseDesc: Between May 25 and June 2, 1978, Gerry Maurice Gascon received the services of the Algoma Hospital in the City of Greater Sudbury. He has not been in contact with anyone since his release from Algoma Hospital.  Gerry usually wears blue jeans, a black leather jacket and cowboy boots.

Case reference: 2007002299.CaseDesc: Michelle Bigras last spoke to her mother on October 11, 1985. At the time she was planning to hitchhike to Warkworth Institution, located near Warkworth, Ontario, to visit her boyfriend. She never arrived.

Scar: Eyes, 2 small scars on left eyebrow

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band

Case reference: 2014001434.CaseDesc: On May 16, 1983, Mario Hudon was seen for the last time as he left his parents’ residence in Levis on the south shore of Quebec. Mario left some personal belongings at the residence

Case reference: 2014001814.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1973, between 2:00pm and 5:00pm Steve Mysick packed a suitcase and left the residence where he was staying, located in Rapid City, Manitoba. Steve Mysick was an outpatient of the Brandon Mental Hospital and had been staying with his friends for 2.5 years at the time of his disappearance.   Mr. Mysick was last seen at the CP train station in Brandon, Manitoba. It is likely Mr. Mysick purchased the ticket to Winnipeg as he had very limited funds available and had lived in Winnipeg in the past. There is no indication if Mr. Mysick actually boarded the train to Winnipeg.   Steve Mysick has never been located and his whereabouts is unknown. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014001970.CaseDesc: On December 20, 1996, Wayne Hansen was seen for the last time as he checked himself out of a hospital in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018041276.CaseDesc:
John Russell Kenny, originally from Ontario, resided without a fixed address in Vancouver, British Columbia. 
Mr. Kenny was known for travelling by train.

Case reference: 2012020163.CaseDesc: An adult male was recovered from the water at Duval Point.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Brown with grey streaks

Case reference: 2006021399.CaseDesc: On June 28, 2000, Charles Siljander was last seen at the Marina Park in Thunder Bay, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance reports state that Charles appeared to be confused, forgetful, and that he had lost a significant amount of weight. On September 15, 2000, Charles’ abandoned vehicle, a grey 1981 Chevy pickup truck, was located on a logging road south of Thunder Bay, and near the Canadian and American border.

Case reference: 2014005451.CaseDesc: John W. Burton along with two passengers (Clifford Dowson and Edward Flett) were flying from Oxford House to Island Lake. Mr. Burton was the pilot of the Cessna 185. Around 11:00 am Mr. Burton made a routine call stating that the airplane would be landing in Garden Hill in approximately 15 minutes. The airplane did not arrive at its destination. The wreckage and all three on board were never located.

Case reference: 2019032078.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2019, at aprroximately 2:19 pm, Shauranne Humphry was seen for the last time at the Anduhyaun Shelter in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000108.CaseDesc: Roger Houle is missing from Montreal since July 12, 1996. Roger is hearing impaired and mute. He left his home without taking anything. He worked for 15 years at the same place and he never advised his employer that he would not be returning to work.

Case reference: 2015011646.CaseDesc: On July 9, 1999, an adult male believed to be between the ages of 40-45 was seen by a train conductor, walking on the edge of the railway in Dorval, Quebec. A few minutes later, the adult male laid down on the railroad tracks and was crushed by the wheels of the train.

Sweater: White, Levi's brand, short sleeve T-shirt, size Large/Extra Large
Coat: Nylon, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Windbreaker, Columbia brand

Case reference: 2014001012.CaseDesc: On May 17, 2001, the skull of a man was discovered in a rural area near Mineral's Road in the town of Conception Bay South, Newfoundland.

Case reference: 2006018899.CaseDesc: William Bowman was last seen leaving his hunting camp, 83 kilometres north of the Town of Massey, Ontario, at the north end of Hwy.# 810, District Algoma, Monestine Township on October 15, 1979.

Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2011001999.CaseDesc: Abdulatif Salman, age 25, suffers from schizophrenia. He left his home on Twyford Street,  on the evening of October 23, 2010 on foot, with no property, money or identification. He has not been heard from since.

Jacket: Grey, Blue, winter, has a hood

Case reference: 2021042160.CaseDesc: On September 16, 2021, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Darren Werner was last seen at his residence in the town Niagara-on-the-Lake in Ontario. It is possible that Darren had gotten into an unknown vehicle.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2014005271.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2009, Fanzheng Meng was seen for the last time at Britannia Park and Beach in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Meng and another man had been aboard an inflatable raft on the Ottawa River. The two men did not return to the shore and the deflated raft was subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014001578.CaseDesc: Benjamin ARSENAULT went missing from 172 Sydney St, Saint John, NB (Rooming House). He was wearing a grey suit coat.

Case reference: 2013000111.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1954, Clifford Edward Sherwood Thorne was seen for the last time at the family residence in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. Clifford left home to go to school and was never seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020105.CaseDesc: Marilyn Bergeron, has been missing since February 17, 2008, from St-Romuald, Québec.

Boots: Suede, Black, with a fur trimmed contour
Coat: Black, Long coat with a fur hood

Case reference: 2014005000.CaseDesc: On August 10, 2004, Mr. Lathlin was reported missing to police by his wife. She indicated to police the last time she saw Mr. Lathlin was on June 14th at which time he was leaving for Winnipeg from The Pas for a medical appointment on the 15th. He did not take any clothing and only took personal grooming items. Mr. Lathlin later called advising his wife he would be staying in Winnipeg as he had another appointment on Thursday. He again called his wife on Saturday morning asking for money. His wife sent the money as requested, however by Tuesday it was not claimed and it was returned to her. Mr. Lathlin has a history of living on the streets and has ties to Edmonton where he spent years on the street there. He also has various medical concerns. It is believed that Mr. Lathlin is likely in Winnipeg of his own volition. Mr. Lathlin's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014003868.CaseDesc: On Sunday, April 18, 1976, at approximately 12:00 pm, Gary Michael Pinkney departed his residence in Fort Churchill, Manitoba on his snowmobile. He was destined for the Hudson Bay and had planned to return home that same evening. On April 19, 1976, at approximately 8:00 am, Helen Pinkney contacted the Churchill RCMP Detachment and reported that her husband had not yet returned home. Extensive searches were done of the area by land and by air for several days with negative results.   The remains of Mr. Pinkney have not been located and given his intended route, it is presumed that he drowned.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with black stone
Scar: 4 inch scar on either left or right leg
Tattoo: Right Forearm, Eagle with rising sun

Case reference: 2016065871.CaseDesc:
On May 10, 1973, a male, approximately 170 lbs., 5'6"-5'8" in height, robbed the Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce on Main Street South in Kenora. He was subsequently shot by police upon getaway which detonated the explosive device that was carried on his body. 
It was later determined that this individual had spent 2 days at the hotel between April 23 and 25, checking-in under the name of "Paul Higgins, 435 Glen Dr., Toronto". Upon check-out, he apparently took a bus to Winnipeg but arranged to have his steamer trunk stored at the hotel. He checked back into the hotel on May 5. The steamer trunk was found in his room following the robbery along with items that were disposed of by the Armed Forces Demolition Unit. The remains of Old Port, Dutch Prince and Teuros-Havanas cigars and cigar packages were also found in his room. The name and address that this individual provided upon check-in were followed-up with negative results.

Boots: Size 10 Chippewa bush boots with 1" thick insole

Case reference: 2020021899.CaseDesc: Nowell HALFE was last seen by family in Edmonton, Alberta in 2013. The last documented occurrence for HALFE puts him in Edmonton, Alberta in January of 2014.

Case reference: 2014005815.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2012 at 1630 hours, Regina Police Service received a phone call from Floyd Kakakaway reporting his brother Frederick Kakakaway missing. Floyd advised that the last time he saw Fred was early in the morning on the 14th of June, 2012 at 0600 hours. Fred told Floyd that he was headed to the Regent Park Safeway to look for cans. He hasn't returned home and no one has seen him since. Fred is a diabetic.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , A cross, forks and a heart
Left Upper Arm, Heart and ribbon with Fred
Deformity: Right Leg, Walks with a slight limp

Case reference: 2018008636.CaseDesc: On February 6, 2018, at approximately 11:30pm, Guerman Pouchkine was last seen in the area of Steels Avenue West and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2015061728.CaseDesc: On the morning of January 25, 1967, Alphonse Brochu left his residence to deliver documents to a government agency in Ottawa, Ontario. That same day, Mr. Brochu’s vehicle was located on the Champlain Bridge, which connects Ottawa to Gatineau, Quebec.

Shoes: Black, Rubber on the toe area
Boots: Black, Rubber on the toe area

Case reference: 2013000083.CaseDesc: On December 4, 1999, Jean-René Duguay was seen for the last time when he was seen jumping off the Lachapelle Bridge in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-René’s body was never found.

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.
